channel.title: C sharp console output
channel.description:
So guys I wrote a console application in C# that calculates all pythagorean triples with a hypotenuse of up to 500 using brute force. The application gives the the option to give the output (the triples combination's) to either the console widow or it will write it to a txt file and open it in notepad.
My problem is when I tell the program to output the data to the console it does not seem to keep all the output, for example if I scroll all the way to the top of the console the first output I can see is "208 156 60" where as in the notepad i see "3 4 5" does anyone know how to fix this?

item.title: C sharp console output
item.dc:creator: @newguy45 newguy45
item.description:
@newguy45 wrote:

[quote=“Unhandled, post:5, topic:365862”][quote author=xx matty xx link=topic=462058.msg3380691#msg3380691 date=1288000875]

my problem is not the size of the console window but the data that it shows, like the first 30 - 40 sets of triples are completely gone in the console window

BufferHeight is not the size of the window.
[/quote]
Exactly.

Why don’t you read the documentation and/or actually try it you lazy fuck.[/quote]

I did read it, just a misunderstanding, thanks for the help

Read full topic

[/quote]

Exactly.

Why don’t you read the documentation and/or actually try it you lazy fuck.

item.title: C sharp console output
item.dc:creator: @xx_matty_xx Justin Bieber
item.description:
@xx_matty_xx wrote:

newguy45:

my problem is not the size of the console window but the data that it shows, like the first 30 - 40 sets of triples are completely gone in the console window

BufferHeight is not the size of the window.

Read full topic

item.title: C sharp console output
item.dc:creator: @Unhandled Unhandled
item.description:
@Unhandled wrote:

Set the Console.BufferHeight property to something more than the number of lines you need.

Documentation: http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/system.console.bufferheight.aspx

Read full topic

item.title: C sharp console output
item.dc:creator: @newguy45 newguy45
item.description:
@newguy45 wrote:

So guys I wrote a console application in C# that calculates all pythagorean triples with a hypotenuse of up to 500 using brute force. The application gives the the option to give the output (the triples combination’s) to either the console widow or it will write it to a txt file and open it in notepad.

My problem is when I tell the program to output the data to the console it does not seem to keep all the output, for example if I scroll all the way to the top of the console the first output I can see is “208 156 60” where as in the notepad i see “3 4 5” does anyone know how to fix this?
